title: it by section 31 of the Health and Social Care Professionals Act 2005 (as
heading: 1. The Physiotherapists Registration Board Approved Qualifications ByeLaw 2020 (S.I. No. 187 of 2020) is hereby revoked with effect from the date
text_raw:
1. The Physiotherapists Registration Board Approved Qualifications ByeLaw 2020 (S.I. No. 187 of 2020) is hereby revoked with effect from the date 
specified in paragraph 2(2), without prejudice to any applications for registration 
received by the board prior to that date.
text_norm: 1 physiotherapist registration board approved qualification byelaw 2020 (s.i no 187 2020) hereby revoked effect date specified paragraph 2(2) without prejudice application registration received board prior date

title: it by section 31 of the Health and Social Care Professionals Act 2005 (as
heading: 2. (1) This bye-law may be cited as the Physiotherapists Registration Board
text_raw:
2. (1) This bye-law may be cited as the Physiotherapists Registration Board 

Approved Qualifications Bye-Law 2025. 

(2) This bye-law comes into operation on 6 May 2025.
text_norm: 2 (1) bye-law may cited physiotherapist registration board approved qualification bye-law 2025 (2) bye-law come operation 6 may 2025

title: it by section 31 of the Health and Social Care Professionals Act 2005 (as
heading: In this bye-law –
text_raw:
3. 

In this bye-law – 

“the Act” means the Health and Social Care Professionals Act 2005 (no. 27 of 
2005) (as amended from time to time); 

“General Division” means the General Division of the register of the 
Physiotherapists Registration Board that was established and now continues 
under section 36 of the Act; 

“Referral for Radiological Diagnostic Procedures Division” means the Referral 
for Radiological Diagnostic Procedures Division of the register of the 
Physiotherapists Registration Board that was established and now continues 
under section 36 of the Act; 

“the Register” means the register of the Physiotherapists Registration Board 
established and maintained under section 36 of the Act.
text_norm: 3 bye-law - act mean health social care professional act 2005 (no 27 2005) (as amended time time) general division mean general division register physiotherapist registration board established continues section 36 act referral radiological diagnostic procedure division mean referral radiological diagnostic procedure division register physiotherapist registration board established continues section 36 act register mean register physiotherapist registration board established maintained section 36 act

title: it by section 31 of the Health and Social Care Professionals Act 2005 (as
heading: 5. The Physiotherapists Registration Board, for the purposes of Section
text_raw:
5. The Physiotherapists Registration Board, for the purposes of Section 
38(2)(a) of the Act, hereby approves the following qualifications as attesting to 
the standard of proficiency required for registration in the Referral for 
Radiological Diagnostic Procedures Division of the Register: 

(1) Professional Certificate in Physiotherapist Referral for Radiological 

Procedures, National University of Ireland, University College Dublin; 

The Minister for Health approves the making of this bye-law. 

GIVEN under the Official Seal 
of the Minister for Health, 

10 April, 2025. 

JENNIFER CARROLL MACNEILL, 

Minister for Health. 

GIVEN under the seal of the Physiotherapists Registration 
Board, 

6 May, 2025. 

and 

RÓISÍN O HANLON, 

Chairperson, Physiotherapists Registration Board. 

JOANNE DOWDS, 

Member, Physiotherapists Registration Board. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [162]

title: it by section 31 of the Health and Social Care Professionals Act 2005 (as
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

This bye-law identifies the qualifications awarded in the State which are 
approved by the Physiotherapists Registration Board as attesting to the standard 
of proficiency required for registration in the General Division of the Register of 
Physiotherapists and the Referral for Radiological Diagnostic Procedures 
Division of the Register of Physiotherapists.
